November 23, 1997: Fiction
COLD MOUNTAIN, by Charles Frazier. (Atlantic Monthly, $24.) A wounded
Confederate soldier journeys home toward the end of the Civil War.
THE GHOST, by Danielle Steel. (Delacorte, $25.95.) On a trip to New England, a
man whose life has gone awry finds answers to his problems in diaries in an old
trunk.
VIOLIN, by Anne Rice. (Knopf, $25.95.) From 19th-century Vienna to present-day
New Orleans: a demonic fiddler preys upon a woman who loves his music.
CAT & MOUSE, by James Patterson. (Little, Brown, $24.95.) Alex Cross contends
with two serial killers determined to take his life.
THE MATARESE COUNTDOWN, by Robert Ludlum. (Bantam, $27.50.) A C.I.A.
officer struggles to thwart the return of an international cabal of power brokers.
LUCKY YOU, by Carl Hiaasen. (Knopf, $24.) A maverick journalist undertakes to
help a woman whose winning Florida lottery ticket has been stolen.
COME THE SPRING, by Julie Garwood. (Pocket, $24.) The visit of a stranger to
the Claybornes' reunion threatens to spoil the family's happiness and content.
FLOOD TIDE, by Clive Cussler. (Simon & Schuster, $26.) Dirk Pitt in pursuit of a
notorious Chinese smuggler at work in the United States.
THE LETTER, by Richard Paul Evans. (Simon & Schuster, $15.95.) In the last
volume of the ''Christmas Box'' trilogy, the Parkin family recovers from its lingering
grief over the loss of a daughter.
THE GOD OF SMALL THINGS, by Arundhati Roy. (Random House, $23.) Death
and secrets haunt a once-prosperous merchant family in contemporary India.
COMANCHE MOON, by Larry McMurtry. (Simon & Schuster, $28.50.) Two Texas
Rangers, veterans of ''Lonesome Dove,'' battle defiant Comanche Indians who are
determined to defend their way of life.
THE ANGEL OF DARKNESS, by Caleb Carr. (Random House, $25.95.) Dr.
Kreizler and his team pursue the kidnapper of a Spanish diplomat's child in 1897
Manhattan.
THE BEST LAID PLANS, by Sidney Sheldon. (Morrow, $25.) The relationship
between a power-hungry governor and a beautiful woman out for revenge.
10 LB. PENALTY, by Dick Francis. (Putnam, $24.95.) A politician's career is
imperiled by actions taken by his enemies against his son, a onetime amateur
jockey.
November 23, 1997
Non-Fiction
ANGELA'S ASHES, by Frank McCourt. (Scribner, $24.) An Irish-American writer
recalls his childhood amid the miseries of Limerick.
MIDNIGHT IN THE GARDEN OF GOOD AND EVIL, by John Berendt. (Random
House, $23.) The mysterious death of a young man in Savannah, Ga.
DIANA: HER TRUE STORY -- IN HER OWN WORDS, by Andrew Morton. (Simon
& Schuster, $22.95.) An updated, expanded version of a 1992 best seller about
the Princess of Wales.
THE MAN WHO LISTENS TO HORSES, by Monty Roberts. (Random House,
$23.) The memoirs of a professional horse trainer.
INTO THIN AIR, by Jon Krakauer. (Villard, $24.95.) A journalist's account of his
ascent of Mount Everest in 1996, the deadliest season in history.
THE PERFECT STORM, by Sebastian Junger. (Norton, $23.95.) An account of
the nor'easter of 1991, focusing on a crew of fishermen from Gloucester, Mass.
THE ROYALS, by Kitty Kelley. (Warner, $27.) Gossip about the private lives of
members of the House of Windsor.
THE CELESTINE VISION, by James Redfield. (Warner, $20.) The author of ''The
Celestine Prophecy'' discusses history, science and spiritual awareness.
CONVERSATIONS WITH GOD: Book 1, by Neale Donald Walsch. (Putnam,
$19.95.) The author addresses questions of good and evil, guilt and sin.
TUESDAYS WITH MORRIE, by Mitch Albom. (Doubleday, $19.95.) A sportswriter
tells of his weekly visits to his old college mentor, who was near death's door.
THE MILLIONAIRE NEXT DOOR, by Thomas J. Stanley and William D. Danko.
(Longstreet, $22.) An analysis of the lives of wealthy Americans discloses that
they have seven characteristics in common.
WAIT TILL NEXT YEAR, by Doris Kearns Goodwin. (Simon & Schuster, $25.)
Recollections of a 50's girlhood on Long Island, in the orbit of the Brooklyn
Dodgers.
DIRTY JOKES AND BEER, by Drew Carey. (Hyperion, $22.95.) Observations on
his life and life in general by the comedian.
CITIZEN SOLDIERS, by Stephen E. Ambrose. (Simon & Schuster, $27.50.) The
United States Army from Normandy to the Bulge to Germany's surrender.
DIANA: A TRIBUTE TO THE PEOPLE'S PRINCESS, by Peter Donnelly. (Courage
Books/Running Press, $12.98.) The life of the Princess of Wales in words and
